_**Blue Planet II**_ is a 2017 British [nature
documentary](/wiki/Nature_documentary "Nature documentary") series on [marine
life](/wiki/Marine_life "Marine life") produced by the [BBC Natural History
Unit](/wiki/BBC_Natural_History_Unit "BBC Natural History Unit"). Like its
predecessor, _[The Blue Planet](/wiki/The_Blue_Planet "The Blue Planet")_
(2001), it is narrated and presented by naturalist [Sir David
Attenborough](/wiki/David_Attenborough "David Attenborough"),[1] while the
main music score was composed by [Hans Zimmer](/wiki/Hans_Zimmer "Hans
Zimmer").[2]

The series was debuted on 29 October 2017 and was simulcast on [BBC
One](/wiki/BBC_One "BBC One"), [BBC One HD](/wiki/BBC_One_HD "BBC One HD") and
[BBC Earth](/wiki/BBC_Earth_\(TV_channel\) "BBC Earth \(TV channel\)"), making
it the first natural history series to premiere on the same day in the United
Kingdom, Nordic regions, Europe and in Asia.

In the United States, the series premiered on Saturday, January 20, 2018, at 9
PM as part of a five-network simulcast on [BBC America](/wiki/BBC_America "BBC
America"), AMC, IFC, Sundance, and WE tv. Subsequent episodes aired on
successive Saturdays on BBC America.

## Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background")]

The series was announced by the BBC in 2013 with the working title _Oceans_ ,
but the title was later changed to _Blue Planet II_ as it revealed on 19
February 2017.[3][4] Filming took place over a course of more than four years;
involving 125 expeditions across 39 countries and produced more than 6,000
hours of underwater dive footage from over an estimated 4000 dives.[5]

A boxset of the Blue Planet II DVDs, with a private letter from presenter Sir
David Attenborough, was presented by [Theresa May](/wiki/Theresa_May "Theresa
May") to Chinese leader [Xi Jinping](/wiki/Xi_Jinping "Xi Jinping") during her
visit to China on 1 February 2018, expressing the determination to end the
plastic pollution with China.[6][7]

## Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Music")]

Composer [Hans Zimmer](/wiki/Hans_Zimmer "Hans Zimmer") returned to score the
series.[2] In September 2017, the BBC announced that the English rock band
[Radiohead](/wiki/Radiohead "Radiohead") had collaborated with Zimmer to
record a new version of "Bloom", a song from their 2011 album _[The King of
Limbs](/wiki/The_King_of_Limbs "The King of Limbs")_.[8] The new track,
"(ocean) Bloom", was recorded alongside the [BBC Concert
Orchestra](/wiki/BBC_Concert_Orchestra "BBC Concert Orchestra"). In a press
release, Radiohead singer [Thom Yorke](/wiki/Thom_Yorke "Thom Yorke") said:
"'Bloom' was inspired by the original _Blue Planet_ series so it's great to be
able to come full circle with the song."[8]

## Broadcast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Broadcast")]

### British
television[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: British television")]

The premiere of the series took place at Bristol's Cinema de Lux on 11 October
2017, with special guest appearance by Attenborough alongside with the
producers and wildlife experts. Bristol has been the global home of BBC's
Natural History programme making for the past 60 years.[9][10][11] The series
was first broadcast on 29 October 2017 (from 20:00 GMT to 21:00 GMT) on [BBC
One](/wiki/BBC_One "BBC One") and [BBC One HD](/wiki/BBC_One_HD "BBC One
HD").[12] The first six episodes included a 10-minute making-of documentary
called _Into the Blue_.[13] The previous week's episode was repeated in an
earlier time slot the following Sunday. The series was critically
acclaimed[14] and gained the highest UK viewing figure for 2017, 14.1
million.[15]

###
International[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: International")]

The BBC pre-sold the series to several overseas broadcasters, which includes
Canada ([Blue Ant Media](/wiki/Blue_Ant_Media "Blue Ant Media")’s licensed
channel for [BBC Earth](/wiki/BBC_Earth_\(Canada\) "BBC Earth \(Canada\)")),
Australia ([Channel Nine](/wiki/Nine_Network "Nine Network")) and New Zealand
([TVNZ](/wiki/Television_New_Zealand "Television New Zealand")), to Europe
with Denmark ([DR](/wiki/DR_\(broadcaster\) "DR \(broadcaster\)")),
Netherlands ([NPO](/wiki/Nederlandse_Publieke_Omroep_\(organization\)
"Nederlandse Publieke Omroep \(organization\)")), Sweden
([SVT](/wiki/Sveriges_Television "Sveriges Television")), Spain
([Telefonica](/wiki/Telefonica "Telefonica")’s BBC Earth block), [Discovery
Channel](/wiki/Discovery_Channel "Discovery Channel") for Latin America and
co-production partnerships with [BBC America](/wiki/BBC_America "BBC
America"), Germany’s [WDR](/wiki/Westdeutscher_Rundfunk "Westdeutscher
Rundfunk"), [France Télévisions](/wiki/France_T%C3%A9l%C3%A9visions "France
Télévisions")[16], China's [Tencent](/wiki/Tencent "Tencent") and
[CCTV-9](/wiki/CCTV-9 "CCTV-9").[17] The series was eventually sold to more
than 30 countries.[16]

The series is set to broadcast internationally on [BBC
Earth](/wiki/BBC_Earth_\(TV_channel\) "BBC Earth \(TV channel\)") channel, and
also commercial television channels in various countries, besides.[16] The
series debuted in Nordic regions and other European countries on 29 October
2017.[18][19][20][21][22] In Asia, the series began to premiere on each early
Monday (from 04:05 SGT to 05:05 SGT) starting from 30 October
2017,[23][24][25] the episode was then repeated on following each Tuesday
evening (from 20:00 SGT).[24][25][26] In Poland, it premiered on 16 November
2017.[27] As for South Africa, it aired from 4 February 2018.[28]

In China, the premiere took place at [Shanghai](/wiki/Shanghai "Shanghai")'s
[East China Normal University](/wiki/East_China_Normal_University "East China
Normal University") on 27 October 2017, with guest appearance by the producer
Orla Doherty and [Mike Gunton](/wiki/Mike_Gunton "Mike Gunton"), the executive
producer of [Planet Earth II](/wiki/Planet_Earth_II "Planet Earth II").[29]
The series is streaming broadcast at Tencent's [QQLive](/wiki/QQLive "QQLive")
from 30 October 2017, with episodes updating every Monday at 18:00
CST.[30][31] It would also be broadcast on the state owned [China Central
Television](/wiki/China_Central_Television "China Central Television")’s
documentary channel, CCTV-9, with episodes airing each Monday from 6 November
2017 at 21:00 CST.[17][32]

In the Netherlands, the series is airing on the Dutch channel [NPO
1](/wiki/NPO_1 "NPO 1"), with episodes airing each Thursday from 28 December
2017.[33] In Belgium, it will air on the Flemish channel
[Canvas](/wiki/Canvas_\(Belgium\) "Canvas \(Belgium\)"), with episodes airing
each Saturday starting from 2 January 2018.[34]

The series is airing in Canada and the United States on 20 January
2018.[35][36][37] In Canada, it will broadcast with a three-network simulcast
across BBC Earth, [Cottage Life](/wiki/Cottage_Life_\(TV_channel\) "Cottage
Life \(TV channel\)") and [T+E](/wiki/Travel_%2B_Escape "Travel + Escape")
channel.[35] In the United States, the series will premier the first episode -
with a five-network simulcast across BBC America,
[AMC](/wiki/AMC_\(TV_channel\) "AMC \(TV channel\)"),
[IFC](/wiki/IFC_\(U.S._TV_channel\) "IFC \(U.S. TV channel\)"), [WE
tv](/wiki/We_TV "We TV") and [Sundance TV](/wiki/Sundance_TV "Sundance
TV"),[36][37] while the remaining episodes will continue to be air every
Saturday on BBC America. It is also available on BBCAmerica.com and the BBCA
app.[38]

As for Australia, the series will premiere on [Nine
Network](/wiki/Nine_Network "Nine Network") and [9Now](/wiki/9Now "9Now") on
17 February 2018.[39][40] In New Zealand, it premiered on 12 November 2017 on
[TVNZ 1](/wiki/TVNZ_1 "TVNZ 1").[41][42]

Examining the role of human
[anthropogenic](/wiki/Human_impact_on_the_environment "Human impact on the

"Microplastics") and [pollution](/wiki/Marine_pollution "Marine pollution")

## Merchandise[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Merchandise")]

### DVD and Blu-
ray[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=10 "Edit
section: DVD and Blu-ray")]

The series was released as a three-disc [DVD](/wiki/DVD "DVD") set[58] as well
as a standard [Blu-ray](/wiki/Blu-ray "Blu-ray") set[59] on 27 November 2017,
and as a six-disc 4K UHD Blu-ray + Blu-ray set[60] on 15 January 2018. It is
distributed by [BBC Worldwide](/wiki/BBC_Worldwide "BBC Worldwide") in the UK.

In the US and Canada, the DVD,[61][62] Blu-ray[63][64] and 4K UHD Blu
Ray[65][66] sets were released on 6 March 2018 and distributed by BBC
Worldwide Americas.

### Book[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=11 "Edit
section: Book")]

An accompanying hardback book was written by [James
Honeyborne](/wiki/James_Honeyborne "James Honeyborne") and Mark Brownlow, with
foreword by David Attenborough. It was published by BBC Books
([ISBN](/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number "International Standard Book
Number") [978-1849909679](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1849909679
"Special:BookSources/978-1849909679")). The book was released on 19 October
2017 in the UK[67][68] and on 1 January 2018 in the US.[69]

### Open University
poster[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Blue_Planet_II&action=edit&section=12 "Edit
section: Open University poster")]

A free poster was made available through the [Open
University](/wiki/Open_University "Open University")'s
[OpenLearn](/wiki/OpenLearn "OpenLearn") website.[70]

Released | 29 October 2017 (Digital)

The musical score and songs featured in the series were composed by [Hans
Zimmer](/wiki/Hans_Zimmer "Hans Zimmer"), Jacob Shea and David Fleming for
[Bleeding Fingers Music](/wiki/Extreme_Music/Bleeding_Fingers "Extreme
Music/Bleeding Fingers"). A digital soundtrack was released on 29 October
2017, while a single physical disc will be available on 1 December 2017 in the
UK.[71][72][73][74]

The soundtrack will be released as special edition LP for [Record Store
Day](/wiki/Record_Store_Day "Record Store Day") on 21 April 2018. [75]
